___host_volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting OpenLDAP data. The final location will be derived from this value plus the name set in `name` (e.g. `/mnt/host_volume/openldap`). Note that this path must be the same on all DCOS agents.

___slapd_volume_size.description: Size in MBs of the volume to be created for internal storage of the SLAPD daemon.

___ldap_volume_size.description: Size in MBs of the volume to be created for the LDAP database

___port.description: Port number to be used for clear communication internally to the cluster.

___external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

___external_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer

___enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

___force_reconfigure.description: Reconfigure the service after the image has been initialized.

___additional_modules.description: Comma-separated list of modules to load.

___mem.description: Memory to allocate to each OpenLDAP node.

___config_password.description: Allows password protected access to the dn=config branch. This helps to reconfigure the server without interruption. Defaults to 'password'

___cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each OpenLDAP node.

___additional_schemas.description: Loads additional schemas provided in the slapd package.
